Name: Bullying
Title: Student/Parent/Visitor Grievance Process | dcps
Page Content: DCPS Comprehensive Alternative Resolution & Equity Team (CARE) The Comprehensive Alternative Resolution & Equity (CARE) Team is responsible for receiving claims of discrimination, sexual harassment, bullying, or any unfair treatment a student, parent or visitor encounters at a DC Public School. The CARE team collaborates with school staff to resolve issues in a timely, equitable and comprehensive manner. #DCPSCARES

Title: Parent University | dcps
Page Content: DCPS Parent University is a workshop series for families facilitated by the Communications and Engagement Office. Each session is designed to help families play their important role in supporting student learning and growth. The workshops are an opportunity for families to share strategies and learn new ones from each other and DCPS Central Office teams. At the end of each session, families should walk away with answers to the following questions:

Name: Language Access Brochure for Families
Title: Language Access for Families | dcps
Page Content: Access and equity, in your language! Mission DCPS strives to ensure that all parents are given a meaningful opportunity to participate in their child’s education program. DCPS students and their families communicate in over 120 different languages. DCPS has a Language Access Unit to ensure the provision of appropriate translation and interpretation services for limited English proficient (LEP) individuals in accordance with the DC Language Access Act.

Name: በቋንቋ እገዛ ማግኛ፣ የወላጅ መመሪያ
Title: DCPS in Amharic (አማርኛ) | dcps
Page Content: This page contains information about DCPS services for Amharic speakers. DCPS፣ የእናንተን ቋንቋ ይናገራል! እንኳን ወደ ኮሎምብያ ዲስትሪክት የሕዝብ ትምህርት ቤቶች (DCPS) በሰላም መጣችሁ። ስልክ ስትደውሉ ወይም ለመነጋገር ስትመጡ፤ ካለምንም ክፍያ አስተርጓሚ በአካል እንዲቀርብላችሁ እና ከሠራተኛ አባሉ ጋር መነጋገር እንዲችሉ ወይም አስተርጓሚ በስልክ ቀርቦ በቋንቋችሁ እርዳታን እንድታገኙ በማድረግ ያገለግላችኋል። የልጅዎን ትምህርት ቤት፣ ማነጋገር ካስፈለገዎት ወይም ማንኛውንም የDCPS ቢሮን በቋንቋዎ ለማነጋገር፣ እባክዎን ያሳውቁን። የልጅዎን አስተማሪ፣ የትምህርት ቤቱን ርዕሰ መምህር (Principal) ሊያሳውቁዋቸው የሚችሉ ሲሆን፤ ወይም ደግሞ የDCPS የቋንቋ ማግኛ ክፍልን በ(202) 868-6508 ደውለው ማነጋገር ይችላሉ።

Name: 2020-2021 Continuous Education Plan
Title: Continuous Education Plan (CEP) | dcps
Page Content: DCPS is committed to a strong foundation for our road to recovery, following the vision of Mayor Muriel Bowser, working in partnership with DC Council, and collaborating across the city with partners and stakeholders. The Office of the State Superintendent of Education (OSSE) requires all local education agencies (LEAs) to develop Continuous Education Plans (CEPs) for the 2022-23 school year in order to communicate to OSSE and the public their plan for supporting situational preparedness, student and staff well-being and accelerated learning.

Name: 2021-2022 Continuous Education Plan
Title: Continuous Education Plan (CEP) | dcps
Page Content: DCPS is committed to a strong foundation for our road to recovery, following the vision of Mayor Muriel Bowser, working in partnership with DC Council, and collaborating across the city with partners and stakeholders. The Office of the State Superintendent of Education (OSSE) requires all local education agencies (LEAs) to develop Continuous Education Plans (CEPs) for the 2022-23 school year in order to communicate to OSSE and the public their plan for supporting situational preparedness, student and staff well-being and accelerated learning.

Name: What people are saying about Chancellor Dr. Lewis D. Ferebee
Title: Dr. Lewis Ferebee | dcps
Page Content: "DCPS has made remarkable progress over the past 10 years. For DCPS’ next phase of excellence, every student from Pre-K to 12th grade should have a high-quality education that prepares them to take advantage of the growth and opportunity in our thriving city."

Name: DCPS Selective High School Admissions Requirements and Processes - English
Title: High School Academic Standards | dcps
Page Content: Friday, March 3, 2023 Common Core Standards The Common Core is a set of nationally recognized academic standards in mathematics and English language arts/literacy. These learning goals outline what a student should know and be able to do at the end of each grade. The standards were created to ensure that all students graduate from high school with the skills and knowledge necessary to succeed in college, career, and life, regardless of where they live.

Name: DCPS Selective High School Admissions Requirements and Processes - Spanish
Title: High School Academic Standards | dcps

Name: Design Lab Overview
Title: Design Lab | dcps
Page Content: Overview As part of the DCPS Strategic Plan, the Design Lab launched in January 2018 to provide forward-thinking school leaders and their teams with the network, resources, and support they need to boldly reimagine their schools. The Design Lab is grounded in human-centered design practices and the belief that individual school communities are uniquely positioned to respond to the needs of their students furthest from opportunity.

Name: Redesign Overview
Title: Design Lab | dcps
Page Content: Overview As part of the DCPS Strategic Plan, the Design Lab launched in January 2018 to provide forward-thinking school leaders and their teams with the network, resources, and support they need to boldly reimagine their schools. The Design Lab is grounded in human-centered design practices and the belief that individual school communities are uniquely positioned to respond to the needs of their students furthest from opportunity.

Name: DCPS Process and Requirements to Conduct Research or Obtain Confidential Data
Title: Conduct Research or Obtain Confidential Data at DCPS | dcps
Page Content: Thank you for your interest in conducting research in DC Public Schools! We want to make DCPS the best urban school district in the country. To this end, we welcome high-quality research in DCPS. We strive to create favorable conditions for research while respecting instructional time and individual privacy.  For existing publicly available data sets, visit dcps.dc.gov/service/dcps-downloadable-data-sets.

Name: Cover Sheet
Title: Conduct Research or Obtain Confidential Data at DCPS | dcps
Page Content: Thank you for your interest in conducting research in DC Public Schools! We want to make DCPS the best urban school district in the country. To this end, we welcome high-quality research in DCPS. We strive to create favorable conditions for research while respecting instructional time and individual privacy.  For existing publicly available data sets, visit dcps.dc.gov/service/dcps-downloadable-data-sets.

Name: DCPS Here For You
Title: School Mental Health | dcps

Our organization fosters caring and healthy learning environments that are responsive to each student in collaboration with families and the community. Our mission is for DCPS to become a trauma-responsive, healing-centered school district that creates learning environments within our schools that acknowledge and address the impact of trauma on student/school success by: ​

Name: Credit Recovery Overview
Title: Pre-K to Graduation Policies | dcps
Page Content: At DC Public Schools (DCPS), we know that students excel when families, educators, school staff, and community members work together. Our policies and implementation guides set clear expectations about the standards of excellence, as well as what supports DCPS will provide along the way. The Pre-K to Graduation: A Policy Guide for Families provides answers to frequently asked questions about topics including attendance, discipline, grading and promotion, credit recovery, and graduation.

Name: Curriculum at DCPS
Title: Curriculum at DCPS | dcps
Page Content: The DC Public Schools (DCPS) curriculum is designed for discovery and delight. Developed by, for, and with DCPS teachers, our units of study contain high-quality resources that teachers can adapt to meet their students’ individual needs. Our student-centered lessons focus on inquiry and investigation. They harness the power of well-crafted questions to build students’ knowledge and skills. From pre-K through graduation, lessons engage students and develop their ability to think critically and make sense of their community and the world.

Name: View more information
Title: DCPS at a Glance: Performance | dcps
Page Content: National Assessment of Educational Progress (NAEP) Trial Urban District Assessment (TUDA) For the ninth year, DC Public Schools (DCPS) has continued steady growth on the NAEP TUDA, which assesses and compares student performance across urban school districts in large cities.

Name: NAEP 2019 Results
Title: DCPS at a Glance: Performance | dcps

Name: Review DCPS' Head Start Annual Report for School Year 2021-2022
Title: Early Learning | dcps
Page Content: Washington, DC has a long history as a leader in providing early childhood education (ECE) and leads the nation in access to Pre-K for both 3- and 4-year old children. Access to high-quality, affordable childcare is a critical need for families across the District, and DCPS is proud to provide free, universal Pre-K in a school environment to ensure all of our young learners are ready for kindergarten. Many of the very best Pre-K classrooms in the region can be found in DCPS!

Name: Elementary School Attendance Tips.pdf
Title: DCPS at a Glance: Attendance | dcps
Page Content: At DC Public Schools, we want every student to feel loved, challenged, and prepared to positively influence society and thrive in life. To reach this ambitious goal, every student needs to be in school every day. However, too many of the young people in our city are not coming to school every day.

Name: Appointment of Principals and Assistant Principals
Title: Open Government and FOIA - DCPS | dcps
Page Content: Open Government Material The District is committed to a transparent, open form of government. District agency websites are required to make certain records available online to the public, if those records exist. In cases where these records exist but are not yet available online, agencies are working to provide them as soon as possible. If you have any questions, please contact the agency’s FOIA Officer.

Title: Conduct Research or Obtain Confidential Data at DCPS | dcps

To this end, we welcome high-quality research in DCPS. Name: 《家长语言协助指南》
Title: DCPS in Chinese (中文) | dcps
Page Content: This page contains information about DCPS services for Mandarin speakers. DCPS使用您的母语！ 欢迎来到华府公立学校(DCPS)。当您致电或拜访我们时，工作人员可以通过口译员或电话提供口译服务，以您的母语为您提供帮助。这项服务是免费的。 如果您需要用您的母语与孩子的学校或任何DCPS办公室进行交流，请告知我们。您可以告诉孩子的老师、学校校长，或致电(202)868-6508与DCPS语言协助科联系。 您还可以下载并打印 《家长语言协助指南》，它包括“我说”卡。当您访问孩子的学校或DCPS办公室时，请带上它，以寻求语言帮助。如需更多信息，请观看这个视频，了解可用的语言服务。

Name: hướng dẫn phụ huynh truy cập ngôn ngữ của mình
Title: DCPS in Vietnamese (Tiếng Việt) | dcps
Page Content: This page contains information about DCPS services for Vietnamese speakers. DCPS nói ngôn ngữ của bạn! Chào mừng bạn đến với các trường công lập DC (DCPS). Khi bạn gọi điện hoặc ghé thăm chúng tôi, một nhân viên có thể giúp bạn bằng ngôn ngữ của bạn thông qua một phiên dịch trực tiếp hoặc qua điện thoại, miễn phí cho bạn.

Name: community service form
Title: Community Service | dcps
Page Content: Established in 1992, The District of Columbia’s Community Service Requirement aims to equip students with the necessary skills and abilities for career and educational advancement as well as motivate students to take an active role as leaders in their communities. DC Municipal Regulations require at least 100 hours of volunteer community service in order for students to graduate.

Name: Dual Language Guide (English)
Title: Dual Language Programs | dcps
Page Content: What is Dual Language Education? Dual Language Education is an educational program in which students study grade level content in two languages. Students typically enter the program in the early years and develop reading, writing, listening, and speaking skills in a second language over the course of a number of years. The long-term goals of Dual Language education programs are:

Title: Afterschool Programs | dcps

Name: Learn more about this process
Title: About Title IX and Frequently Asked Questions | dcps
Page Content: Students at DC Public Schools (DCPS) should feel loved in an educational environment free of sexual harassment, sex-based discrimination or sexual misconduct. Any harassment or discrimination that occurs within a program or activity of DCPS, including all online instruction, is subject to DCPS policies. For more information please review the Frequently Asked Questions below.
